text: When you get a new project idea, what excites you most?

options.text: Turning the idea into a working system that scales
Pitching it to others and getting them onboard
Organizing steps and processes to execute it efficiently
Collaborating with teammates to shape it together

text: Faced with a problem, your instinct is to…

options.text: Brainstorm creative ways to solve it
Research what's been done before and adapt it
Ask others for input and discuss
Analyze the data quietly until a clear pattern emerges

text: What kind of task gives you the most satisfaction?

options.text: Building something new from scratch
Optimizing a messy workflow
Coaching someone to achieve their goals
Presenting or promoting a new idea

text: How do you usually make important decisions?

options.text: Based on intuition and big-picture vision
Based on available data and logical reasoning
After talking with others and getting feedback
After testing small experiments

text: In a team, you naturally take on the role of…

options.text: The one who ensures everything is organized
The one who motivates and energizes the group
The one who supports and connects everyone
The one who challenges assumptions and suggests bold changes

text: Which sentence feels most like you?

options.text: I like exploring new possibilities.
I like knowing the system is predictable.
I like understanding people's motivations.
I like understanding how things work.

text: When deadlines get tight, you…

options.text: Reorganize priorities and focus on what's critical
Rally the team and keep morale high
Trust your instincts and take bold action
Follow the plan precisely, step by step

text: What do you enjoy more?

options.text: Talking to new people and exchanging ideas
Refining a process to make it smoother
Launching new initiatives quickly
Maintaining order and consistency

text: When starting something new, you prefer to…

options.text: Plan carefully before acting
Jump in and figure it out along the way
Find collaborators early
Build a framework first

text: Which describes you better?

options.text: Structured, meticulous, detail-oriented
Charismatic, energetic, people-first
Adaptable, practical, steady
Bold, imaginative, curious

text: You feel drained when…

options.text: There's too much chaos or uncertainty
You have to work alone for too long
You're stuck doing repetitive tasks
You need to manage other people's emotions

text: You feel most in flow when…

options.text: Everything runs efficiently and precisely
You're presenting or persuading
You're refining or debugging a complex process
You're connecting people who should work together

text: Which do you value more in a colleague?

options.text: Reliability and consistency
Creativity and vision
Emotional intelligence
Technical mastery

text: Your workspace is usually…

options.text: Organized, everything in its place
Lively and full of conversations
Controlled chaos — I know where everything is
Clean, minimalist, functional

text: When someone disagrees with you, you…

options.text: Want to discuss and understand their feelings
Want to check the facts
Want to find the most logical resolution
Want to persuade them through your perspective

text: In a crisis, you're most likely to…

options.text: Stay calm and rely on structure
Step up and lead communication
Adapt quickly with creative solutions
Analyze the situation objectively before acting

text: What kind of praise means the most to you?

options.text: You make everything run so smoothly.
You always find the smart fix.
You inspire everyone around you.
You come up with ideas no one else sees.

text: If you had a day off to work on anything you like, you'd…

options.text: Design a new workflow or automation
Explore a new idea or tool
Help a friend improve their project
Organize and declutter something

text: When joining a project late, you first…

options.text: Observe the existing system to see how it works
Talk to people to understand dynamics
Ask about goals and deadlines
Look for what could be improved or innovated

text: You prefer success that comes from…

options.text: Precision and efficiency
Connection and influence
Innovation and originality
Consistency and reliability

text: Which statement resonates most?

options.text: Ideas are only as good as their execution.
Nothing great happens without people.
Innovation keeps the world alive.
Details determine success.

text: You learn best when…

options.text: Experimenting and doing
Listening and discussing
Observing patterns over time
Studying frameworks and systems

text: If your startup grew fast, what would you focus on?

options.text: Maintaining structure and scalable processes
Expanding the team culture and collaboration
Experimenting with new products
Promoting the brand and community

text: Which kind of meeting do you prefer?

options.text: Problem-solving with clear outcomes
Brainstorming with free-flowing ideas
Syncs with the team to stay aligned
Quick, efficient standups

text: At the end of a workday, you feel best when…

options.text: You've completed all planned tasks
You've inspired or helped someone
You've figured out a better way to do something
You've started something exciting
